description: A collaborative web-based design and prototyping tool that allows teams to create, test, and share user interface designs in real-time. It streamlines the design-to-development process with features for vector editing, interactive prototyping, and developer handoff, ensuring consistency across web and mobile applications.

A data preparation and analytics platform that enables users to blend, clean, and analyze data from multiple sources without requiring coding skills. Designer offers a visual drag-and-drop interface for building analytics workflows, performing statistical analysis, and creating predictive models.

An open-source web-based notebook platform that enables interactive data exploration, visualization, and collaboration. Zeppelin supports multiple programming languages including Python, Scala, R, and SQL, allowing data scientists and analysts to create shareable documents that combine code, visualizations, and narrative text.

A Git-based version control and code collaboration platform designed for software development teams. Bitbucket provides source code management, pull request workflows, continuous integration pipelines, and deployment capabilities, enabling development teams to collaborate on code and manage software release processes.

A developer experience platform that helps engineering teams track distributed software architecture and manage metadata, components, and dependencies. It provides a unified component catalog and health scorecards to improve visibility, compliance, and operational readiness across complex microservices environments.

A project management and issue tracking platform used for agile software development and project coordination. Jira enables teams to plan, track, and release software projects using customizable workflows, sprint planning tools, reporting dashboards, and integration with development tools.

cloud-based Enterprise Agile Planning (EAP) platform that connects business strategy with technical execution. It aggregates team-level data to provide real-time visibility across the enterprise, enabling organizations to scale agile practices, align portfolios with strategic goals, and optimize value delivery across complex development environments.

A product management tool designed to help teams capture, prioritize, and collaborate on product ideas and roadmaps directly within Jira. It enables product managers to gather insights, link ideas to development tasks, and transparently communicate product strategy to stakeholders.

A high-performance, fully managed relational database engine compatible with MySQL, built for the cloud to deliver the speed of high-end commercial databases with the cost-effectiveness of open source. It features auto-scaling storage, replication across availability zones, and serverless options for unpredictable workloads.

A fully managed PostgreSQL-compatible database engine that offers high availability and durability by automatically replicating data six times across three availability zones. It optimizes performance for demanding applications and integrates seamlessly with other AWS services for monitoring, security, and machine learning.

A monitoring and observability service that provides data and actionable insights for AWS resources and applications. It collects logs, metrics, and events to help users detect anomalies, visualize performance with dashboards, and automate actions to optimize operational health and resource utilization.

A serverless, NoSQL key-value database designed for high-scale applications requiring single-digit millisecond performance. It offers built-in security, continuous backups, and automated multi-region replication, making it ideal for mobile, web, gaming, and IoT applications handling massive amounts of data.

A web service that provides secure, resizable compute capacity in the cloud, allowing users to launch virtual servers (instances) tailored to specific workloads. It offers a wide variety of processor, storage, and networking options to support everything from general-purpose applications to high-performance computing.

A serverless data integration service that makes it easy to discover, prepare, and combine data for analytics, machine learning, and application development. It includes features for ETL (extract, transform, and load) jobs, a data catalog for metadata management, and visual tools for building data pipelines.

A platform for collecting, processing, and analyzing real-time, streaming data such as video, audio, application logs, and website clickstreams. It enables applications to respond instantly to incoming data streams, supporting use cases like live video analytics and real-time dashboarding.

A fully managed service that makes it easy to deploy, secure, and operate OpenSearch clusters for log analytics, application monitoring, and full-text search. It supports visualization through OpenSearch Dashboards and integrates with other AWS services to ingest and analyze high volumes of data securely.

A fully managed, petabyte-scale cloud data warehouse that uses SQL to analyze structured and semi-structured data across data warehouses, operational databases, and data lakes. It delivers fast query performance using columnar storage, massive parallel processing, and machine learning-based optimization.

A collection of managed services that simplifies setting up, operating, and scaling databases in the cloud. It supports multiple database engines—including Amazon Aurora, PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, Oracle, and SQL Server—handling routine tasks like hardware provisioning, database setup, patching, and backups.

A data lake analytics platform deployed on Amazon EKS that allows users to run fast, interactive SQL queries across distributed data sources without moving data. It provides a single point of access to query data in data lakes, warehouses, and streaming systems with enterprise-grade security and performance.

An object storage service offering industry-leading scalability, data availability, security, and performance. It allows customers of all sizes to store and protect any amount of data for a range of use cases, such as data lakes, websites, mobile applications, backup and restore, archive, and big data analytics.

Microsoft's cloud-based relational database service built for modern applications and analytics workloads. Azure SQL Database provides managed database capabilities with built-in intelligence, automatic scaling, and enterprise-grade security features including threat detection and data encryption.

A command-line shell and scripting language that serves as the default command interpreter for most Linux and Unix-based operating systems, providing an interface for executing system commands and automating administrative tasks.

A Power BI optimization tool that identifies and removes unused columns and measures from semantic models while providing comprehensive lineage analysis across reports, dataflows, and downstream models.

A modern, object-oriented programming language developed by Microsoft as part of the .NET framework. C# is used for building Windows applications, web services, mobile apps, and enterprise software solutions.
A data integration tool designed for Salesforce data replication and synchronization. DBAmp enables organizations to extract, transform, and load Salesforce data into SQL Server databases.

A Linux-like environment and command-line interface for Windows that provides a comprehensive collection of GNU and Open Source tools, enabling developers to run native Linux applications on Windows systems.
Unity Catalog - Databricks' governance solution that provides centralized access control, data discovery, and lineage tracking across all data assets.

The underlying compute platform that provides scalable, cloud-based processing power for data and AI workloads. It includes autoscaling clusters, serverless computing options, and optimized runtimes for different workload types.
A business intelligence and visualization platform integrated within Databricks that enables users to create interactive dashboards, reports, and analytics applications.

A machine learning platform that provides capabilities for building, training, and deploying AI models. It includes MLflow for experiment tracking, automated machine learning features, model serving infrastructure.
Interactive, collaborative computational environments that combine code, visualizations, and narrative text in a single document. Databricks notebooks support multiple programming languages.
Job scheduling and workflow automation capabilities that enable organizations to create, monitor, and manage complex data pipelines and analytics processes.
A data science platform that provides capabilities for data preparation, machine learning, and model deployment. Dataiku offers both code-free and code-friendly approaches.
A query execution and performance analysis tool that enables developers to write, test, and optimize DAX queries for Power BI, Analysis Services, and Excel data models.
A cloud-based integration platform-as-a-service (iPaaS) that enables organizations to connect applications, data, and processes across cloud and on-premises environments.
A containerization platform that enables developers to build, share, and run applications in isolated, portable environments using lightweight containers instead of traditional virtual machines.
An open-source ML and LLM observability framework that enables teams to evaluate, test, and monitor AI systems throughout their lifecycle.
A JavaScript charting library that enables developers to create interactive and responsive charts and dashboards for web and mobile applications.
An open-source programming language developed by Google, designed to combine simplicity with high performance and scalability for modern computing environments.
A web service that converts addresses into geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude) and vice versa.
An open-source Python library for data validation, documentation, and profiling that helps teams maintain data quality and reliability.
An infrastructure as code tool by HashiCorp that enables teams to define, provision, and manage cloud and on-premises infrastructure using declarative configuration files.
A high-level programming language that runs in web browsers and server environments. JavaScript is essential for creating interactive web applications.
An open-source web application that creates and shares interactive computational documents containing code, visualizations, and explanatory text.
An AI-powered supply chain design and planning platform (now part of Coupa) that helps organizations model, optimize, and simulate their supply chain networks.
A flexible framework for building controllable cognitive architectures that enables developers to create reliable AI agent systems with diverse control flows.
A cloud-based diagramming and visual collaboration platform used for creating flowcharts, organizational charts, network diagrams, and other visual representations.
ManageEngine's Privileged Access Management solution that provides centralized control and monitoring of privileged accounts and access.
A probabilistic programming platform for Bayesian statistical modeling and inference that enables sophisticated data analysis through flexible model specification.
Data Quality Services - a SQL Server component that provides data cleansing, matching, and monitoring capabilities to improve data quality.
An AI-powered code completion and suggestion tool developed by GitHub in partnership with OpenAI.
A low-code/no-code platform for building custom business applications without extensive programming knowledge.
A cloud-based workflow automation platform that enables users to create automated processes between applications and services.
A free Windows application for business intelligence that enables analysts to connect to diverse data sources, transform and model data, and create interactive visualizations.
A self-service ETL tool within the Power BI ecosystem that enables organizations to extract, transform, and load data from various sources.
An Azure-based analytics platform that enables developers to integrate Power BI reports, dashboards, and tiles directly into custom applications.
A bridge application that securely transfers data between on-premises data sources and Microsoft cloud services.
An enterprise-tier capacity-based offering that provides dedicated cloud resources for organizations requiring advanced analytics capabilities.
A user-based license that enables business professionals to create, publish, and share Power BI content while collaborating on data-driven insights.
A licensing model for Microsoft SQL Server based on the number of cores in the server.
A data integration and workflow platform that provides extract, transform, and load (ETL) capabilities for data warehousing and business intelligence projects.
An integrated environment for managing Microsoft SQL Server infrastructure, databases, and services.
A lightweight, open-source code editor that supports multiple programming languages and provides customization through extensions.
An integrated development environment (IDE) for building applications across multiple platforms and languages.
A cloud-based development environment that provides on-demand development resources accessible from any device.
A Windows system service that enables users to automatically run programs, scripts, or tasks at specified times or in response to specific events.
A minimal installer for conda and mamba package managers that provides Python distribution management for data science and scientific computing.
A Python library for creating, manipulating, and studying complex networks and graphs.
A JavaScript runtime environment that enables server-side JavaScript development.
An open-source infrastructure as code tool under Linux Foundation governance that enables teams to define, provision, and manage cloud infrastructure.
A data management and process automation platform that enables organizations to automate SAP data transactions, migrations, and business processes.
The Python API for Apache Spark, a distributed computing framework designed for processing large datasets across clusters of computers.
A high-level programming language used for data science, machine learning, web development, and automation.
A free, open-source geographic information system (GIS) that enables users to create, edit, visualize, analyze, and publish geospatial information.
A business intelligence and data visualization platform that enables users to create interactive dashboards and perform self-service analytics.
A programming language and environment designed for statistical computing, data analysis, and graphics.
An enterprise analytics platform that combines business intelligence, planning, and predictive analytics in a single cloud solution.
An enterprise data warehousing solution that integrates data from SAP and non-SAP sources to provide a single version of truth for reporting and analytics.
The traditional desktop client interface for accessing SAP enterprise software systems.
Salesforce's artificial intelligence platform that brings AI capabilities to CRM and business processes.
An integration platform-as-a-service (iPaaS) that enables organizations to connect applications, data, and devices across cloud and on-premises environments.
A programming language that combines object-oriented and functional programming paradigms, running on the Java Virtual Machine.
A suite of standards-based ODBC and JDBC drivers that enable seamless connectivity between applications and disparate data sources.
A minimalist AI agent framework by Hugging Face that enables developers to build powerful AI agents with minimal code.
A data quality and observability platform that monitors data pipelines, detects anomalies, and ensures data reliability across organizations.
A platform for searching, monitoring, and analyzing machine-generated data from various sources including servers, networks, applications, and IoT devices.
Structured Query Language - the standard programming language for managing and manipulating relational databases.
A robotic process automation (RPA) platform that enables organizations to automate repetitive, rule-based business processes using software robots.
An integrated development environment designed specifically for scientific computing and data analysis in Python.
A productivity development environment for Power BI and Analysis Services tabular models that accelerates semantic model development.
A data integration tool focused on extracting data from SAP systems and loading it into various target systems.
A search-driven analytics platform that enables users to search their data using natural language queries and get instant answers.
A database management and development toolset that enables developers and DBAs to reduce time and effort spent on daily tasks.
An AI-powered development environment that enables developers to build software using multiple autonomous agents.
YAML Ain't Markup Language - a human-readable data serialization format used for configuration files.
